text: Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS) posted better-than-expected fiscal first-quarter results after market close on Tuesday.
label: pos

text: Revenue and adjusted earnings per share notably beat expectations for the period as CEO Robert Iger said in the company's earnings release that it was a "strong first quarter," that surprised almost everybody.
label: pos

text: But perhaps the biggest takeaway from the report was the company's blowout results from its new streaming-TV service, Disney+.
label: pos

text: Disney+ "has exceeded even our greatest expectations," said Iger in the quarterly update.
label: pos

text: "Thanks to our incredible collection of brands, outstanding content from our creative engines and state-of-the-art technology, we believe our direct-to-consumer services, including Disney+, ESPN+ and Hulu, position us well for continued growth in today's dynamic media environment."
label: pos

text: The entertainment company ended the period with 26.5 million subscribers for Disney+, which launched in November -- midway into the company's fiscal first quarter.
label: pos

text: Analysts, on average, were expecting the streaming service to garner 25 million subscribers.
label: neu

text: A day after the service's launch in November, Disney had already gained 10 million signups.
label: pos

text: While subscriber growth has slowed since the initial launch, it's still growing at an impressive rate.
label: pos

text: The company also notably said Disney+ subscribers are already bringing in an average of $5.56 in revenue each -- higher than $4.44 per subscriber for ESPN+.
label: pos
